bug.author: scizors
bug.description:
open 3D widows error i installed using anaconda windows link:<denchmark-link:https://anaconda.org/open3d-admin/open3d>https://anaconda.org/open3d-admin/open3d</denchmark-link>
from .open3d import * # py2 py3 compatible ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found.

comments.comment: I am having the same issue. I tried on python 2.7 and 3.7 with VSCode and both had same issue. I can successfully use open3d-python 0.7.0.0 but cannot use the latest ver.

Install open3d instead of open3d-python. I tested Open3D 0.9.0 pip and Conda installation under Windows 10 64-bit with python3.7 and they're all working for me. Here's the full terminal recording for pip install: <denchmark-link:https://terminalizer.com/view/fcc321e93273>https://terminalizer.com/view/fcc321e93273</denchmark-link>
Here's the full terminal recording for conda install: <denchmark-link:https://terminalizer.com/view/0c3811b03274>https://terminalizer.com/view/0c3811b03274</denchmark-link>
Please try with the exact same command (including creating a fresh environment and activating it), and see if the problem still exists. Please feel free to reopen the issue.
